page.title: 14RIVER NENE AT WANSFORD
page.content: The bridge is very long at Wansford because it has to cross both the river and its marshy flood plain. Wansford was chosen as a bridge point because the river is quite narrow here. At the bridge the Nene is 8.8 metres wide. Elsewhere it is over 15 metres wide. The speed of the river is 0.29 metres per second although it is slower at the edges. This speed prevents the river silting up. The depth of the river is 3.8 metres, allowing boats to use it. If the river was not deep the boats would not be there. Also many fishermen come to Wansford to fish. Along the banks of the river there are foot-paths but fields and houses face on to the river also.
